item.title: Road has been flooded on both sides of the road for weeks, 12th February
item.description:
Flooding on the Old GLoucester Road. This has been there for weeks now. People are forced to drive of the other side of the road to avoid it, which is dangerous
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Old Gloucester Road, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Barnmeadow Road, 12th February
item.description:
Severe Deterioration of Road Surface – Multiple Expanding Potholes There are multiple potholes and areas of severe surface breakdown from the junction of Abbotts Leys Road and Barnmeadow Road through to the Delavale Road junction. The road surface has now worn through to the sub‑base, with stones and loose material being thrown up when vehicles pass through puddles. The potholes are growing rapidly in size and pose a hazard to drivers, cyclists, and pedestrians. This section requires urgent inspection and repair before further deterioration or damage occurs.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Barnmeadow Road, Winchcombe, Winchcombe
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unpermitted roadworks problem, 12th February
item.description:
She advised there are roadworks going on Newstead Road and so the Insley Garden bus stop is closed. There is no temporary bus stop in place and these road works are due to go on for 6 weeks. She is elderly and has poor mobility and can't afford to get taxi's so feels she is trapped in her house for the next 6 weeks while there is no bus.
Report on FixMyStreet
